units.title: Suppress mesoderm-derived immune cells in organoid culture
units.text: In our paradigm, the organoid culture method suppresses mesoderm-derived immune cell/microglia presence to achieve a more consistent forebrain identity and cell composition.
units.rationale: Describes a step to obtain uniform forebrain organoids by eliminating immune cells.

units.title: Address astroglia- and neuron-dependent pathologies without immune interference
units.text: This allowed us to specifically address initial astroglia- and neuron-dependent pathologies without immune or secondary inflammatory responses.
units.rationale: Highlights the purpose of the previous suppression step for focused pathology studies.

units.title: Supplement ALI-COs with microglia or allogeneic immune cells
units.text: Supplementation of ALI-COs with microglia/allogeneic immune cells could address immune-related pathogenesis in the future.
units.rationale: Proposes adding immune components to model immune aspects of disease.

units.title: Slice organoids to create paired control‑treatment samples
units.text: The slicing of prematurity organoids provides an important advantage as two adjacent slices derived from the same organoid could serve as a control–treatment pair, increasing the confidence in analyzing drug‑related effects.
units.rationale: Provides a method for internal controls in drug testing.

units.title: Improve nutrition and reduce necrotic core by slicing
units.text: Sliced organoids may improve nutrition, suppressing the necrotic core that often features in whole organoids.
units.rationale: Describes a benefit of slicing for organoid health.

units.title: Pharmacological rescue of protein homeostasis and DNA damage
units.text: The partial pharmacological rescue of early protein homeostasis- and DNA damage-related pathogenesis in our patient‑specific organoids illustrates how C9 CO slices can be used for personalized and broader drug discovery strategies.
units.rationale: Shows a protocol for testing therapeutic compounds in patient‑derived slices.

units.title: Use C9 CO slices for personalized drug discovery
units.text: C9 CO slices can be used for personalized and broader drug discovery strategies.
units.rationale: Summarizes the application of sliced organoids in precision medicine.

units.title: Generate control‑treatment pairs from adjacent slices
units.text: Two adjacent slices derived from the same organoid could serve as a control–treatment pair.
units.rationale: Emphasizes the practical pairing of slices for experimental comparison.
